author: staronline@reachplc.com (Tom Sunderland)
title: BREAKING Jack Grealish's family 'feared being held hostage' home robbery for Â£1million of jewellery
text: Manchester City ace Jack Grealish's family "feared they were being held hostage" in a home burglary that saw them robbed of more than Â£1million worth of goods. England winger Grealish was away on duty with the [Premier League](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/latest/premier-league) champions at [Everton](https://www.dailystar.co.uk/latest/everton-fc) when the burglary in understood to have taken place on Wednesday. A source close to the family told [The Sun](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/25187642/jack-grealish-family-feared-held-hostage-gang-thugs/): â€œThe family are really shaken. The gang took a lot of watches and jewellery." The same source went on to say the family first feared "they could be facing a hostage situation or worse." It's understood the invaders made off with seven figures worth of prized possessions but that nobody was harmed in the raid. It's understood girlfriend Sasha Attwood, Grealish's mother and father, his grandmother, two sisters and brother were all at the 24-acre property while the robbery took place. A Cheshire Police statement quoted by The Sun read: â€œAt around 9.50pm on Wednesday December 27 police were called to reports of a burglary. The caller reported that a number of items had been stolen. "Officers supported by police dogs and National Police Air Service were deployed and searches were conducted in the local area but there was no trace of the suspects. More to follow. This is a breaking sports story and is being constantly updated with the latest news, pictures and videos. Please refresh the page regularly. author: APA
title: Georgian PM highlights religious diversity as â€œone of main wealthâ€ of country
text: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze on Thursday highlighted religious diversity as â€œone of the main wealthâ€ of the country, in his address at the Iftar, the fast-breaking evening meal of Muslims in Ramadan, which was held in honour of the Muslim community in Georgia on behalf of the PM, [APA](https://apa.az) reports citing Agenda Georgia. "The Muslim community, our integral part, makes a great contribution to the construction of our country, and our brotherhood has a long history behind itâ€, Kobakhidze said. He stressed Georgia was â€œa unique countryâ€ where â€œGeorgians and Azerbaijanis, Shiite and Sunni Muslims pray in the same mosqueâ€, and noted the tradition of â€œpeaceful coexistence and brotherhoodâ€ was â€œvery preciousâ€ for Georgia, emphasising â€œwe have been proving it with our deedsâ€. "The state has handed over 237 mosques to the Muslim community and 20 more are ready to be given as well. The state has increased its funding to the community to $1.5 million, and following the economic growth, this support will increase even moreâ€, the Head of the Government pointed out.

text:

AsÃ­ lo hizo saber el Secretario de Seguridad Ciudadana General. Miguel Morales Miranda, quien dijo que a travÃ©s de su despacho en coordinaciÃ³n con la ZODI-FALCÃ“N, iniciarÃ¡n plan estratÃ©gico de vigilancia y patrullaje en costas falconianas con el apoyo de las autoridades de las islas vecinas para contrarrestar rutas ilegales de migrantes a Aruba y Curazao.
Las autoridades chavistas indicaron que las medidas se implementarÃ¡n con la finalidad de minimizar esta actividad ilegal, la cual representa un riesgo a la vida de aquellas personas que emigran de forma clandestina.
SubrayÃ³ el funcionario, que quienes insistan en practicar este tipo de ruta de forma ilegal, recibirÃ¡n todo el peso de la ley tanto en territorio venezolano como fuera de nuestras fronteras.
Es de resaltar, que esta declaraciÃ³n coincide con el reciente pronunciamiento de autoridades en Aruba quienes tajantemente seÃ±alaron que quienes intenten ingresar ilegalmente a la isla, serÃ¡n detenidos y deportados sin derecho a asilo.

author: O Povo
title: MÃºcio fala em boa relaÃ§Ã£o de Lula com ForÃ§as Armadas: "Ambiente fraterno"
text: MÃºcio fala em boa relaÃ§Ã£o de Lula com ForÃ§as Armadas: "Ambiente fraterno"As trÃªs agendas do presidente na Bahia, em Pernambuco e no CearÃ¡ foram relacionadas aos militares [JÃºlia Duarte](https://www.opovo.com.br/autor/julia-duarte/)Tipo [NotÃ­cia](https://www.opovo.com.br/conhecaopovo/tiposdenoticias) Ministro da Defesa, JosÃ© MÃºcio, [ avaliou que o presidente Luiz InÃ¡cio Lula da Silva (PT)](https://mais.opovo.com.br/reportagens-especiais/2022/12/08/lula-tem-desafio-de-contornar-tensao-com-as-forcas-armadas.html) vive um bom momento com os militares. Em evento nessa sexta-feira, 19, durante inauguraÃ§Ã£o da pedra fundamental do ITA em Fortaleza, o ministro ressaltou que existe "ambiente fraterno" entre o chefe do Executivo e as ForÃ§as Armadas. "O ambiente do presidente da RepÃºblica com as ForÃ§as Armadas, eu duvido que tenha algum dia, algum presidente, tenha tido um ambiente tÃ£o fraterno. Presidente ontem (quinta) inaugurou uma obra da AeronÃ¡utica em Salvador, hoje (ontem) lanÃ§ou a escola de sargentos, hoje lanÃ§a o ITA", disse. Seja assinante O POVO+ Tenha acesso a todos os conteÃºdos exclusivos, colunistas, acessos ilimitados e descontos em lojas, farmÃ¡cias e muito mais. [Assine](https://mais.opovo.com.br/) "SÃ£o trÃªs extraordinÃ¡rias obras da ciÃªncia da academia e da ciÃªncia da AeronÃ¡utica que sÃ£o nordestinos. Nossos filhos vÃ£o ficar aqui, sonhar e ter famÃ­lias e filhos aqui. Fazer com que o desenvolvimento fique aqui", disse. Na quinta-feira, 18, Lula participou de cerimÃ´nia de assinatura do acordo de parceria para a implantaÃ§Ã£o do Parque TecnolÃ³gico Aeroespacial da Bahia. JÃ¡ na sexta-feira, 19, na parte da manhÃ£, o petista e outros ministros participaram da cerimÃ´nia de inauguraÃ§Ã£o da Escola de Sargentos das Armas, no Recife. MÃºcio tambÃ©m ressaltou que os investimentos sÃ£o obras "que passam governos" e nÃ£o tem carÃ¡ter eleitoreiro. "NÃ³s, da polÃ­tica, nos acostumamos com aquelas obras que o governo tem a ideia e inaugura, sÃ£o as obras que vÃ£o servir para as prÃ³ximas eleiÃ§Ãµes. Tem obras que passam governos. As obras estruturantes sÃ£o obras para as geraÃ§Ãµes, ultrapassam as eleiÃ§Ãµes", afirmou. O ministro fez fala semelhante em Pernambuco, onde tambÃ©m defendeu a destinaÃ§Ã£o de recursos para o setor. Quando assumiu o governo, Lula passou por momentos de tensÃ£o com alas das ForÃ§as Armadas, que integravam, na gestÃ£o de Jair Bolsonaro (PL), cargos efetivos no primeiro escalÃ£o. MÃºcio foi escolhido sendo um nome do agrado dos militares por transitar tanto entre parlamentares quanto nos quarteis. Lula defendia a desmilitarizaÃ§Ã£o da gestÃ£o e certo afastamento do que acontecia na gestÃ£o anterior. Seu governo tambÃ©m [Ã© favorÃ©vel Ã  proposta de emenda Ã  ConstituiÃ§Ã£o (PEC) ](https://www.opovo.com.br/noticias/politica/2023/08/30/governo-lula-desiste-de-barrar-nomeacao-de-militar-da-ativa-em-ministerio-civil.html)que restringe a participaÃ§Ã£o de militares das ForÃ§as Armadas em processos eleitorais. A ideia Ã© que, para disputar cargos eletivos, membros das ForÃ§as Armadas tenham de deixar a carreira militar, entrando para a reserva. Hoje, militares vÃ£o para a reserva se eleitos. Quando Lula assumiu o Planalto, havia 6.157 oficiais em cargos comissionados. Jair Bolsonaro foi o presidente que mais nomeou militares no primeiro escalÃ£o, mesmo na comparaÃ§Ã£o com governos da ditadura.DÃºvidas, CrÃ­ticas e SugestÃµes? author: @ValleyNewsLive
title: Grand Forks man sentenced, accused of shooting at officers
text:
Grand Forks man sentenced, accused of shooting at officers
GRAND FORKS, N.D. (Valley News Live) - Jeffrey Simpson Jr. of Grand Forks was sentenced Wednesday afternoon, on a laundry list of charges, including attempted murder.
Simpson Jr. was sentenced to 25 years in prison, after a shootout with law enforcement in March of 2024.
In making his decision, the judge said, â€œWeâ€™ve seen too many acts of violence against law enforcement officers. Simpson Jr. needed to be held accountable and made an example of.â€
On March 22nd, 2024 officers responded to the 3300 block of Primrose Court in Grand Forks, for a report that a homeless man shot at officers in a residential neighborhood. Simpson Jr. was also accused of strangling his ex-girlfriend, kicking her, punching her and holding a gun to her head. Simpson was found guilty in the case.
On Wednesday, during the hour-long hearing in Grand Forks County Court, prosecutors read a statement from the domestic violence victim. Simpson Jrâ€™s dad was there as well, and spoke to the courtroom.
â€œPlease know once our son is released from prison, as a father I will make it my mission that he live a happy and productive life. My son has struggled for many years with this addiction. He is a good man. Just along the way he lost himself.â€ Simpsonâ€™s father said.
Simpson Juniorâ€™s dad, and the defense both argued that he had no prior history, adding that he is former military and addicted to meth. Still, the judge said none of those things should excuse what happened in March of 2024.
â€œThe nine months I spent in a relationship with him were a period of unrelenting terror, the effects of which continue to shape my life and the lives of my family.â€ one victim said.
The woman says the night before the shootout, she and her son were removed from their home by officers and taken to a shelter. The next day, officers showed up to arrest Simpson. That is when police say, he got out of his vehicle and opened fire on them.
â€œEverything that was presented at the trial sure seems to indicate that you were doing that with the intent to hit those folks and end their lives. It just didnâ€™t work out that way.â€ Judge Kay Knudson said.
No one was hit by the gunfire, but it happened in a busy area, at an apartment complex in Grand Forks. After Wednesdayâ€™s sentencing, the defense asked if the judge could make sure Simpson Jr. got his military uniform back. Judge Knudson said, â€œhe would have to figure that out on his ownâ€ adding â€œheâ€™s not even sure if he deserves it.â€
Simpson Jr. was also ordered to pay thousands of dollars in restitution. He is also ordered to have no contact with any of the victims.
Copyright 2025 KVLY. All rights reserved.

author: Mary Chastain
title: Biden Border Crisis: ICE Arrests Al Shabaab Terrorist After He Roamed U.S. for a Year
text: [ Biden Border Crisis: ICE Arrests Al Shabaab Terrorist After He Roamed U.S. for a Year](https://legalinsurrection.com/2024/02/biden-border-crisis-ice-arrests-al-shabaab-terrorist-after-he-roamed-u-s-for-a-year/) Meanwhile, majority of illegal crossings have shifted to Arizona and California. [0 Comments](https://legalinsurrection.com/2024/02/biden-border-crisis-ice-arrests-al-shabaab-terrorist-after-he-roamed-u-s-for-a-year/#respond) ICE confirmed to the Daily Caller that it arrested an al-Shabaab terrorist after he [spent a year in America](https://dailycaller.com/2024/02/01/ice-confirms-dcnf-report-al-shabaab-terrorist-roamed-free/): A member of the Somalia-based al-Shabaab terrorist group was caught entering the U.S. illegally in March of 2023, but was soon released into the country and roamed free for nearly a year before he was arrested in Minnesota by ICE in January, [according]to an internal agency memo obtained exclusively by the DCNF. ICE Acting Director Patrick Lechleitner confirmed the terrorist was arrested â€œwithin 48 hoursâ€ of the agency learning that he was actually on the terror watch list. ( [RELATED: EXCLUSIVE: Terrorist Caught Illegally Crossing The Border Was Allowed To Roam Free For Nearly A Year, Memo Says]) â€œI can say that for this individual, within 20 â€“ within 48 hours, excuse me â€“ of ICE becoming aware of his status as on the watch list, within 48 hours, he was apprehended,â€ Lechleitner said during a press briefing on Thursday. â€œI want to commend our personnel because as soon as we became aware of that, within 48 hours, he was apprehended and [now] heâ€™s currently in ICE custody.â€ But it is [not ICEâ€™s fault](https://twitter.com/BillMelugin_/status/1753132091360055734). The man crossed illegally, was released, and only matched after a year. The border patrol and ICE have been overwhelmed for years due to Biden. The memo [received](https://dailycaller.com/2024/01/29/exclusive-terrorist-caught-illegally-crossing-border-allowed-roam-free-nearly-year-memo-says/) by the Daily Caller stated that the Terrorist Screening Center ran his name through the system. It came up as a mismatch. But then the Terrorist Screening Center determined the man belonged to al-Shabaab. As soon as the center made the determination, ICE sprang into action and arrested him in Minnesota. The Daily Caller did not detail how the center redetermined the manâ€™s status. The publication did not share the memo to conceal the confidential sourceâ€™s identity. One ICE official told the Daily Caller, â€œPeople have been released prior to completed records checks being returned on a subject. Which would not allow proper processing and placement of a potential terrorist once those results were known.â€ John Fabbricatore, a retired ICE field director, explained it could take a long time to retrieve the entire background check: â€œThe overburdening of the Border Patrol with the excessive amounts of illegal border crossers has forced faster processing times, which doesnâ€™t allow for a more vigorous initial investigation into a migrants background. The background checks currently being run only initially search out criminal history in the United States, not outside its borders. It could take days, weeks, or months to connect derogatory information coming from other databases.â€ Iâ€™m not shocked ICE arrested the man in Minnesota. The state has a large Somalian population, which is the home of al-Shabaab. Border Crossings Bill Melugin at Fox News reported via X that the majority of border crossings have shifted to Arizona and California from Texas. Since the summer, we have seen migrant waves flood into Arizona, overwhelming the border patrol. Many of the migrants had to stay in outside cages. (I never saw AOC). Texas has clamped down itâ€™s border so it makes sense the shift is growing. â€œPer CBP sources, over the last week of January, Border Patrol apprehended 32,809 illegal immigrants,â€ wrote Melugin. â€œ23,576 of them (71.8%) were in AZ & CA.â€ Eagle Pass, TX, the location of the current fight between the state and feds, saw up to 4,000 crossings a day in December. Last week, Eagle Pass crossings averaged 200. Melugin offered two potential reasons: Texas has locked things down on their side of the border, and Mexico has increased enforcement against migrants arriving in the MX state of Coahuila following Sec. of State Antony Blinkenâ€™s visit to MX in December. Mexico is now suddenly stopping migrants from boarding trains, and is removing migrants from their northern border down to their southern border following that meeting. And the migrants who do cross there now find a very unwelcoming posture from the state of TX with legions of soldiers, troopers, and razor wire, & threat of arrest. It is unknown what the US offered MX in return for this cooperation. Border patrol sources told Melugin agents apprehended 5,240 illegal immigrants at the border. The agents took in 3.854 of them in Arizona and California. Thatâ€™s 73.5%. Itâ€™s insane what is going on. [Illegal Immigrants Landing in San Diegoâ€™s Upscale La Jolla Area Makes Waves on Social Media](https://legalinsurrection.com/2024/01/illegal-immigrants-landing-in-san-diegos-upscale-la-jolla-area-makes-waves-in-social-media/) [Biden Border Crisis: Military-Age Men From Across the Globe Flood Across Arizona Border](http://Biden Border Crisis: Military-Age Men From Across the Globe Flood Across Arizona Border) [Border Crisis: Fetterman Lectures Democrats, Illegal Crossings Ramp up in California](https://legalinsurrection.com/2023/12/border-crisis-fetterman-lectures-democrats-illegal-crossings-ramp-up-in-california/) [Lukeville, AZ, Becomes â€˜Epicenter of the Border Crisisâ€™](https://legalinsurrection.com/2023/12/lukeville-az-becomes-epicenter-of-the-border-crisis/) [Tucson Sector Border Patrol Temporarily Reducing Social Media Posts Due to â€˜Ongoing Migration Surgeâ€™](https://legalinsurrection.com/2023/11/tucson-sector-border-patrol-temporarily-reducing-social-media-posts-due-to-ongoing-migration-surge/) [Biden Border Crisis: Video Shows Largest Illegal Crossing in Texas, Illegal Immigrants Scaling the Wall in Arizona](http://Biden Border Crisis: Video Shows Largest Illegal Crossing in Texas, Illegal Immigrants Scaling the Wall in Arizona) [New Migrant Wave Straining Arizona Border With Many Detained in Outside Cages](https://legalinsurrection.com/2023/09/new-migrant-wave-straining-arizona-border-with-many-detained-in-outside-cages/) [](https://legalinsurrection.com/subscribe/) [DONATE](https://raisedonors.com/legalinsurrectionfoundation/general) Donations tax deductible to the full extent allowed by law.

author: Tony Williams
title: Chiefs Re-Signed DT Marlon Tuipulotu
text:
The Kansas City Chiefs re-signed DL Marlon Tuipulotu , according to Aaron Wilson .
Tuipulotu, 25, was a sixth-round pick by the Eagles out of USC back in the 2021 NFL Draft.
He made it onto the active roster as a rookie and appeared in five games. The following season he appeared in nine games before winding up on injured reserve in November 2022 due to a torn meniscus.
Tuipulotu was among the Eagles final roster cuts this offseason and he signed with the Chiefs practice squad just two days after being released.
He is the older brother of Chargers LB Tuli Tuipulotu and the cousin of 49ers S Talanoa Hufanga .
In 2024, Tuipulotu appeared in two games for the Chiefs and recorded four tackles and one tackle for loss.
